Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about Gen Z teenagers' perspectives and engagement with TikTok in 2024-2025. Here's what the research reveals:

## Gen Z TikTok Usage Patterns in 2024-2025

Roughly six-in-ten teens say they use TikTok, with about six-in-ten visiting TikTok daily, including 16% who report being on it almost constantly. Teen girls are more likely than boys to say they use TikTok almost constantly (19% vs. 13%).

## Gen Z's Changing Relationship with Information Sources

It's not that Gen Z doesn't believe in experts. Rather, it's that social media has rewired the way they think about credibility. Nearly 40% of Gen Z users now prefer TikTok or Instagram over Google for searches, and Gen Z relies on Google 25% less than Gen X for their searches.

## TikTok as Discovery Platform

TikTok remains their top discovery platform, especially for shopping (77%) and news (63%). Now more than ever, genuine human perspectives are in demand due to the huge rise in AI-generated content. TikTok and Reddit thrive on community-driven content, which adds credibility. When searching for product reviews or recommendations, Gen Z often prioritizes real-life testimonials over brand messaging.

## 2024 Consumer Behavior Trends

Three in 5 Gen Zers are following the "underconsumption core" trend on TikTok, leading many to cut back on online shopping. This reflects a growing awareness of financial responsibility among this generation.

## Social Media Engagement Patterns

Consumer research shows that 81% of Gen Zers spend more than one hour a day on social media, with nearly 60% reporting social media usage of three hours a day or more, with nearly 43% getting their news daily from social media platforms.

## Brand and Marketing Implications

Gen Z are quick to suss out anything that feels forced and are intentional about where they spend, so brands must ensure their content is genuine. Influencers are the main way Gen Z discovers products, signaling that brands must rethink their search and media strategies to stay relevant in 2025.

The search results show that Gen Z teenagers in 2024-2025 view TikTok not just as entertainment but as a primary source for news, product discovery, and authentic perspectives, fundamentally changing how they interact with information and make purchasing decisions.
